qas.question: What animal species was delisted in August 2008?
How long had the squirrel been listed as endangered?
Which president signed an Act directing the delisting of the Northern Rocky Mountain population of gray wolf?
When was the gray wolf added to the list?

plausible_answers.text: the Department of Defense and Full-Year Appropriations Act

qas.question: What did the Secretary of the Interior sign in 2011?
What is the latin name for the flying squirrel?

context: Two examples of animal species recently delisted are: <a0_0>the <b3_0>Virginia northern flying squirrel<b3_0/><a0_0/> (subspecies) on August, 2008, which had been <a1_0>listed since <b4_0>1985<b4_0/><a1_0/>, and the gray wolf (Northern Rocky Mountain DPS). On April 15, 2011, <a2_0><b5_0>President Obama<b5_0/><a2_0/> signed <b6_0>the Department of Defense and Full-Year Appropriations Act<b6_0/> of 2011. A section of that Appropriations Act directed the Secretary of the Interior to reissue within 60 days of enactment the final rule published on April 2, 2009, that identified the Northern Rocky Mountain population of gray wolf (<b7_0>Canis lupus<b7_0/>) as a distinct population segment (DPS) and to revise the List of Endangered and Threatened Wildlife by removing most of the gray wolves in the DPS.
